basics.name: Samantha Mallari
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2026.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Manoa, HI

work.company: UH Manoa College of Social Sciences
highlights: Provide technological assistance for students and instructors

work.company: UH Manoa College of Natural Sciences
work.summary: Internship as part of ICS 390 Computer Ethics for Lab Assistants
highlights: Assisted students in the lab portion of ICS 111 Intro to Computer Science
Aided students with learning and applying various CS concepts using Java
Learned foundations for video game and app development
Created a platformer game and presented it to peers and industry professionals
Collaborated with peers to develop storyboards and game mechanics

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Awarded to students who earn a GPA of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more taken for a grade during a semester.

awards.title: Manoa Academic Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded to recognize the academic strengths of first-year, degree-seeking students who enroll at UH Manoa in the semester following the completion of their high school diploma.

awards.title: First place - Detector Building
awards.summary: My partner and I won first place in 2022 among ~10 other teams. We built an electronic probe from scratch to measure the salinity of water samples using prototype materials. Also, I learned to program and operate an Arduino, how to design circuits/electronics, and developed basic skills in electrical engineering.
